segment.text: I heard on the holovisions from time to time:
can and will be used against you.
But I did have an idea.
Forty minus nothing equals twenty-two, no, forty-nine.”
The android furrowed its brows, an accidental computer trait
that it had picked up from human behavior.
Then, “Stage programming tests 345.9.35 proven incorrect: humans insusceptible to pattern-based programming.”
and waddled mechanically out of the room.
The section of wall closed behind it.
what the future holds for us,
we did, how could I ever expect it to be?
Now, my greatest fear is not of the future, but my own past.
until I began the journey for myself.
All I know now is how I work through everything, day to day.
And I will not be alone.
I have my last hour with Edwin.
All he can talk about, for a change, is how excited he is to be actually taking me on a date.
It is like he has suddenly let go of his past love,
or at least decided to try
and then kisses my cheek quickly.
as if he were a grandma
who has kissed my cheek a thousand times.
Seconds after Edwin was out of sight, Chris walks up.
He smiles that million dollar smile of his
and I feel my insides melt.
Immediately warning bells go off in my head.
that Edwin does nothing for me with a kiss
and Chris does everything with just a smile.
so I just kind of stare at him.
Yeah, let me just stop at my locker."
NaNoWriMo Novel: Ch.4 Trip to the Lake .
Chris laughs and makes a sweeping gesture,
I laugh and start walking towards my locker.
Chris falls into step besides me.
I follow him out the doors and to his car.
He opens my door for me
Crush came on half way to the lake
and then notice Chris looking at me.
You're messing with a very complicated girl, remember?
as we pull up to the lake.
He starts walking to a big oak, "I'll show you."
When we get to the oak
"I put it up just for you"
¦ Last night after I took you home."
as I sit down on the swing.
I was incapable of so much more
I was different than ordinary blind people,
if there was such a thing as ‘ordinary blind people’.
I wasn’t able to do little things,
He hadn’t known me before today.
I’d known him longer than this, like I’d
sitting in the other rows of seats.
Then, a doctor pushed a small table in front of each of us.
There were some noodles, vegetables, and a bottle of water.
I headed back into my room.
I wanted to stay away from Karon as much as possible.
Having no idea of what he planned to do to me actually might’ve been better than knowing.
All I could think of them doing for me was bringing me more pain.
People tried to convince me to go through with all of the things
doctors kept trying to fix by telling me
"I can't imagine not being able to see.
as if I was missing out on anything at all.
Colors were just an abstract idea;
there's really no way to imagine seeing anything but the colors
It's really the same thing for me.
Someone came into my room- no, two people.
Their voices were both exactly the same,
they were girls, probably only eight or nine.
They stepped up closer to my bed.
one of them said, followed by,
as she descended into the icy cold depths of Hades’s realm.
She couldn’t see the spirits undoubtably floating around her,
Finally she came to the Styx itself.
Its awful waters were cluttered with the waste of humans – broken pottery, discarded farming tools, ruined jewelry.
And there, leaning heavily on his pole,
She hesitantly handed him the coin,
and his dark, empty eyes invited her on the barge.
When the barge landed on the opposite bank of the terrible Styx, Psyche clutched the cake
she would need for the next horror.
A few yards in front of her, growling and snarling, Cerberus sat with trails of drool hanging from his teeth.
and sped past his huge figure.
Persephone herself was kind enough, for the wife of the King of the Dead.
She thanked Psyche for coming down,
filled a box with cosmetics for Aphrodite,
and sent Psyche on her way.
and our snooty teacher walked in announcing himself.
I spent most of the long class
or glancing at Anna taking notes intently.
I noted her eyes, her smile.
I’ve never seen one like it.
I looked at my schedule “Algebra with Mrs. Coudrote.”
“Ah, the Cood” She said with a sly tone.
it was a nickname for the teacher.
I had to catch myself from standing and staring.
I caught up to her side.
I tried to think of something to say to continue a conversation.
“Yah, like I have been here awhile.”
Anna began explaining the history of the school
and soon I got lost within a few sentences
I loved listen to her talk.
Her voice was soft and quick.
I was stuck on her already.
But would I win the war?
I began bobbing to some incoherant song
that had lodged itself into my head.
it was a favorite of mine: La Paga.
the arm swinging; the actual singing along.
I got through most of the song, full-out dancing,
when the man stormed through the sliding door again.
not sure what else to call it.
The android folded his arms, utterly stumped.
but the next you send vocal impulses in a coherent pattern, in a manner
“Bud, you got a heck of a lot more to learn about humans.”
and we got on the spaceship.
Both girls had a weird habit of finishing each other's sentences
These girls were much too curious about this.
I didn't want to scare them with my own thoughts about what Karon could be planning.
Theo had asked even more than this.
When I'd been talking to him, though,
He'd wanted to know the things
he asked about to understand more about me.
The girls just asked out of curiosity.
just a small realization I’d had.
"Girls, why don't you go back to your rooms for a little while?"
As soon as Psyche had repeated the dreary process
and stepped out of the Underworld,
she breathed in the clean air.
A musty smell clung to her lungs.
She began to walk, slowly, back to Aphrodite’s “house,”
when arrogance started to take over her.
Very few living people had come out of the Underworld.
Surely Aphrodite would let her see her husband again,
her hair and face were a mess.
Psyche’s eyes fell on the box of cosmetics.
A little touch here and there couldn’t hurt.
She carefully cracked the box open –
when he saw her lying on the ground, her form crumpled.
He swept over to her body
and picked her up in his arms.
as he wiped the drug off her eyelids.
and flew off to Zeus’s palace.
Wrinkles formed in Zeus’s hearty face
as he agreed to Eros’s proposal.
he laughed, “but she certainly can’t say no to this!”
Eros pushed a very shaky Psyche up to Zeus,
who promptly laid his hands on her shoulders.
“I, King of the Gods, grant you,
Psyche the mortal, the greatest gift a god can give a mortal.
Immediatley Psyche’s form began to shimmer,
and Eros ran up to her,
enfolding her in his arms and wings.
Right in the nick of time, Aphrodite burst into the room.
“You have no right touching a mortal!”
Eros looked up at his enraged mother.
“But that is where you are wrong.
and we will get married the proper way.”
Aphrodite turned incredulously to Zeus for consolation,
“You cannot argue to the marraige of a god to a goddess.”
Aphrodite sat down, and the happy lovers celebrated.
He was staring at me so intently,
And I'm not supposed to be the nervous one.
I started babbling about the school and blahblahblah
but he continued to stare with the cute little glimmer in his eyes.
when Emmett comes back into the picture.
I pushed the thoughts of my football player away
Too bad, we reached the Algebra classroom quickly.
He opened the door for me
and I strolled up to the teacher.
The Cood said to me with a fake smile.
I told her in my sweetest voice
she was talking to a fucking angel or something.
I winked at Cameron before heading to my Geometry class, a level up.
I could Tell a Certain Someone
Of course I want to make out with you.
Why do you even bother asking?
Of course all I want to do is feel your arms wrapped around me.
But it just can’t happen today.
Not today, maybe not tomorrow, maybe not ever.
Maybe because I value your life.
Maybe because I don’t want to be the reason
why my father has to tear you to shreds.
The bigger question is why do you keep asking why?
No I’m not going with your crazy plan.
Its crazy and going to get us both killed.
Plus only a monkey would fall
for “President-elect Obama has ordered me to stay home today so you’re just going to have to leave me home alone.
No I’m not sneaking a guy over.
Please don’t make this harder than
Please don’t make me feel any guiltier about not being able to be with you.
Especially since your the one who doesn’t have time to make it official.
In one of the happiest stories in Greek mythology, Love (Eros) and Soul (Psyche)
The story of Eros and Psyche is said to be the first fairy tell ever written, and most definetly the sweetest.
Nothing can seperate the two, not even the tempermental, envious goddess of Love.
the reason Eros is not in many myths was because Psyche kept him home all the time
– he went from being mischevious and abusing of his power to a well-loved man (god?)
causing him immense and lasting sadness,
but what kind of a story is that?
In one of the happiest stories in Greek mythology, Love (Eros) and Soul (Psyche)
The story of Eros and Psyche is said to be the first fairy tell ever written, and most definetly the sweetest.
Nothing can seperate the two, not even the tempermental, envious goddess of Love.
the reason Eros is not in many myths was because Psyche kept him home all the time
– he went from being mischevious and abusing of his power to a well-loved man (god?)
causing him immense and lasting sadness,
but what kind of a story is that?
He was leading me in a different direction,
It was all in a daze.
It was as if I couldn’t focus,
couldn’t seem to actually pay attention to my surroundings.
I tripped over a log Grant
and the woman had easily jumped over.
I was scratched by thornbushes they’d dodged.
was urging to scream out with all my will, but for some reason,
This really was like a movie, just like me watching another version of everything around me,
while the real me was in a parallel episode,
The ‘me’ in both scenes was screaming at the other ‘me’ to say something, to warn them.
We ran out into the road
and sat down in a chair next to my bed.
You seem to be adjusting well to your room."
"Those two have a very"¦ interesting ability.
once they learn to control it."
Anyway, I came in here to talk about-"
It's too confusing to get into now."
how, no matter how rude and angry I could be, Karon would always stay so calm.
It only seemed to make me angrier.
we have the ability to fix it.
Do you want to know about the procedures?"
so I wouldn't have to face him anymore.
as the bed beneath me shook.
Why was this making me so angry?
I was picturing something horrible, something on its way to kill Karon.
My mind took this as a challenge, something
My voice took on the monotonous tone
it always does when I'm about to use my ability.
"Regan-" he put his hand on my shoulder.
Why did he act so understanding?
yet he was still trying to "˜comfort' me.
I just wanted to be left alone!
and my ears throbbed with pain.
This only happened to me once before, when I just couldn't control anything.
Through the fog created by tubes of addictive hell
Why were they staring at me?
Though at first glance they might SEEM to be my contemporaries who where going to school
but who was worst; the girl
minding her own business at the edge of the woods, or the 16 year olds
The bowl of popcorn was settled between them, rather awkwardly at best.
Both Chloe and Alex decided to fully immerse themselves in the film on the screen to try and deny themselves the truth in what had happened just minutes ago.
For 3/4 of an hour they were sucessful.
that the other was only a figment of their imagination.
Until the moment they both reached into the bowl
and found not only popcorn kernels but the cool touch of the other’s skin.
Alex’s fingers lingered in the bowl
while Chloe quickly withdrew her hand.
From that point on, neither friend could focus on the movie.
As though suddenly inspired, Alex grabbed the bowl
and placed it on the table with a sheepish grin.
Chloe attempted to muffle a laugh.
“Tickets please,” repeated the sharply dressed man in the little blue cap.
In a blur a lovely woman with startlingly dark hair took a seat across from Jake.
handing two tickets to the agent, “Destination Absolution.”
As the agent left Jake ventured,
He tried framing her face in a little square with his hands.
“I’m not Alfred Hitchcock, if that’s what you’re thinking,
” she teased with a wry smile.
How the crap did I get on a train?
“So many questions, how can I keep up?”
Her eyebrow raised in mocking salute.
You’re Ana Christina, and...but you live in Florida,
“That you need to lay off the alcohol to avoid these weird dreams, mijo.”
The Birth of a Killer [Serial Killer Challenge]
The blood had always been the problem, or rather the washing away the blood.
Now, after finding the cave, there were no problems.
Now it was time to kill a human.
My first choice was a nine year old girl;
She was in my ninth grade class.
She had red hair, freckles and no close friends.
I followed her home for two weeks,
just getting to know the route and her neighborhood.
I picked the ideal spot, a full block under construction.
And during the winter months the workmen were gone
All I did was call out her name
and she walked over to me.
One quick glance around and I struck her with a piece of iron pipe.
I dragged her over to a ditch, and covered her with a piece of scrap plywood.
After dark I carried her to the cave.
The cave was the home of hundreds of rats.
and cut open both of her legs
: that was to draw the rats.
Three days later I went back
Both came swirling out of her stereo to the side of her bathtub.
reaching far beyond the four walls
Physically, she was in her bathroom.
floating down a river,next to a shore with white lights
strung through trees, sparkling as bright as the stars above.
On the shore were Aretha Franklin and Bud Powell along with many others
playing a private show for her.
PlaySam CookeHer boat floated lazily down the river with wind kissing her cheeks and the lapping at the boat,
pushing it that much farther down and into her imagination all the way back into her bathroom
where the four walls enclosed and entrap her memory once again.
cold chills up her spine and her skin shriveled
as if trying to wring water out of itself.
and pulled a warm towel close to her shivering body.
The helicopters were coming our way,
“Come on, over here,” the woman screamed,
sliding down the face of the cliff.
and without thinking, jumped down as well.
Landing with a loud thump onto a dusty road leading into even more woods,
once I caught up with her.
The dogs obviously did catch a scent,
The only way to lose them would be by either crossing the river,
How did she know this landscape?
soon I heard the soft splashing sounds of the water,
I looked behind me, all around me.
The water was only five, six feet right here.
We could all get out of here-
Arenn stood high on the cliff,
looking down at the smoldering ruins,
the smoke blowing into the westward setting sun.
and after centuries of slavery, our people were finally freed, but at what cost?
The multitudes, of which I was one,
as she stood surveying the destruction
she had caused with what I feared
As if reading my thoughts, Arenn turned and looked deep into my eyes.
Odd, but I had never thought of our leader as beautiful before, only sly.
Now she seemed to have the beauty of a raven silently flying overhead, an ebony silhouette against the fire-red sky.
“Child,” she said again, “Why do you frown so?
Are you not happy to be released after so many long years of imprisonment?”
I saw a fire in her black eyes.
The Lights go on at Night
Have you ever talked to our neighbors Abbey?
Have you ever seen them outside of their home?
It’s freaking me the fuck out.
The lights go on at night,
a few shadows move by the windows,
and that’s all we know of them.”
“Ok, but Seth, this is our opportunity to finally meet them.
They decorated their house with orange lights for Halloween, their porch lights are on,
they’re reaching out for the first time,
don’t spoil it with your ignorant assumptions.
I’m taking our boy over there
for trick or treat and you’re going to hand out candy.
Their cars haven’t moved in four months!
If you’re going then I’m coming too.”
“Fine, put a bowl of candy on the steps,
Her boy sheepishly enters the room in his pumpkin suit
Many questions have surrounded the rise of the new Midnight,
a girl only known as Alice Black.
who she is, very few know
who she was, or even where she came from.
who is in all of these categories.
known as Alice Black for a year and a day in her youth at the orders of the former Queen of Midnight, came with her to live at the Night Palace in Amaron,
and stood by as the Queen of Midnight instructed her in the ways of the old order.
when the former Midnight died, and when the girl
now known as Alice Black ascended the Opal Throne.
The girl now known as Alice Black was,
in her youth, known by the name of Alice Lepic, daughter of Pierre Lepic, Dawn, and of Claire Anderson, also of an important station, 9:00 in the morning.
Alice had never been happy being the daughter of two of the Days.
She regarded them- her parents, and all the days, in fact- with a semblance of disdain.
The night was the only thing
Two days before her 13th birthday, her parents, Dawn and Morning Tea, as she called her mother,
took her to the Wayward Diviner,
as was customary for children of the Days.
The Wayward Diviner had no doubt in his mind.
who she was to be the heir of as soon as they walked through the door.
They told him to spin the Bone Wheel,
so they could see for themselves.
Thirteen times the wheel went round,
